14th-level Scholar feature

You learn how to take advantage of your enemies failings. As an action you can expend 3 focus points to evaluate the strategy of a creature that you can see. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw equal to your spell save DC. If the target fails, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

- You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made against the target.

- The target suffers a –2 penalty to attack and damage rolls made against you.

- You gain +2 bonus to all saving throws made against the target’s actions.

- The target suffers a –2 penalty to all saving throws made against your actions.

Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

You can transform unexpended focus points into an equal number of magicka points as a bonus action on you turn (one-to-one conversion). You can create magicka, up to a maximum of 7 points in this manner.

Any magicka you create with this feature vanishes when you finish a long rest.
